claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and strong type I interferon signaling.

evidence.quote: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.
Type I interferon response score (normalized units) | 3.1 | 1.0 | Marked induction after mRNA vaccination in tumors
Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: The induction of type I interferon signaling significantly expands the tumor's antigen presentation landscape, particularly for MHC-I, increasing tumor visibility to T cells.

evidence.quote: Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome | 62.3% | 37.3% | Broader antigen display after intratumoral mRNA vaccination
Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome | 40.6% | 20.6% | Strong expansion of MHC-I-presented landscape
A broader peptide repertoire appears on MHC-I, improving tumor visibility to T cells.

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors.

claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination primes tumors to become more responsive to immune checkpoint blockade, potentially by increasing PD-L1 activity and T-cell infiltration.

evidence.quote: PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue | 2.4x | 1.0x | Checkpoint axis became more targetable
Intratumoral CD8+ T-cell density fold-change | 1.8x | 1.0x | Increased immune infiltration with combination therapy
Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice and aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort.

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely.

claims.claim: Retrospective analysis of metastatic patients suggests that prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination is associated with improved survival when receiving subsequent ICI treatment.

evidence.quote: Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment
Retrospective human survival comparison p-value | p=0.01 | N/A
Translational arm: a retrospective cohort of metastatic patients receiving ICI treatment, compared by prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination status.

claims.caveat: Tumor-type mix and treatment-history heterogeneity limit direct causal interpretation.
